title: Fallout Season 2 Episode 1 recap: 'The world may end, but progress marches on'
summary: The second season premiere gets a big Vault-Boy thumbs up from me.
body: Please note: major spoilers for Fallout Season 2 Episode 1! I love my jobโI just don't love it to the exclusion of everything else in my life, and people who put their work above all other concerns, like friends, family, and their physical and mental health, make me a bit uneasy. Case in point: Hank MacLean, played by Kyle MacLachlan in Prime Video's Fallout series. Hank is the ultimate business zealot. Before the bombs fell, Hank was so dedicated to his work at Vault-Tec that he voluntarily had himself cryogenically frozen for a couple centuries. He got thawed out, married a Vault-dweller named Rose, had two kids, and then murdered 30,000 people with an A-bomb. All in the name of business. And he was just getting started! In the final episode of Season 1, Hank saw his daughter learn what a monster he was, left her behind to mercy-kill her ghoulified mother, then stomped his way across the desert to reach New Vegas. As Season 2 begins we see that Hank has not been shattered by the consequences of his evil acts: he's actually invigorated and ready for more. Discovering that the front desk at Vault-Tec has collected over 400,000 unread messages over the past two centuries actually bโฆ
